lexUnit.name: grimace.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ugly, twisted expression on a person's face, typically expressing disgust, pain, or wry amusement.

sentence.text: Little did he know that it was n't a smile , but a grimace of pain .
Cowley allowed that slight grimace of disgust to touch his face that told of his total contempt for this particular villain .
A crushed grimace of defeat crossed Charlotte 's face at his words .
It was the kind of grin on the face of a leather-jacketed youth when he revs his motor bike and watches the grimaces on the faces of those standing around .
VINNY Jones revealed it was a ` toe-job " which led to Paul Gascoigne 's grimace in the famous photo of their close encounter .
The cold empty eyes had not changed : the face , half-hidden by a hood , now wore a permanent grimace .
It was a mirthless grimace , but , ` Oh , yes , I 'll probably tell her all about it .
Monitoring motor activity in newborn babies , Dr McGuiness found boys to be significantly more active , spending less time asleep and performing more facial grimaces than girls .
Franco gave him a wry grimace and shrugged his shoulders .
He gave a rueful grimace .
Melissa gave a mischievous grimace as she suddenly remembered the disapproving gleam in her friend 's eye on learning where she was spending the evening and , possibly , the night .
His Royal Highness raised an eyebrow and puckered one side of his mouth in a very characteristic grimace of amusement .
Both had reflected that the faces of the dancers , women more than men , but men , too , could just as well have been distorted in screams and grimaces of pain as in enjoyment .
His face scratched and bleeding , contorted in a grimace of pain and anger , Benton toppled backwards , one hand reaching for the knife .
Candy 's pert features wrinkled in a grimace of disgust .
She stood off to one side , her lips twisted into a grimace of disgust at their vulgarity .
With a snarl that changed her smiling face into a grimace of pure hatred she threw herself at him , the weapon slashing for his face .
Stephen made a grimace at him .
He made a guilty grimace of assent .
Emmie made a nervous grimace with her hideous orange lips .
` If you do not stop at the road-block , you are dead , " says a soldier with a grimace .
` Well , if this war wound stands up ter walkin' up those stairs I might be able ter get it down ter the dustbin for yer , " he said with a grimace .
She turned to Candy with an apologetic grimace .
